chapter.title: Installation Source
chapter.para: Before you start to use any of the examples provided in the following chapters your build system has to have a valid installation source for the distribution you are about to create an image for. By default, all examples will connect to the network to find the installation source. It depends on your network bandwidth how fast an image creation process is and in almost all cases it is better to prepare a local installation source first.

sect1.title: Create a Local Installation Source
sect1.para: The following procedure describes how to create a local SUSE installation source which is stored below the path /images/CDs. If you are using the local path as described in this document you only need to flip the given path information inside of the example config.xml file.
